status_notes: Case Resolved. The Commission had a scheduled water main shutdown in coordination with the Schrafft?s building as part of our water main project that is ongoing on Medford Street.  As a result of the heavy water use at their facility and the need to tie in their domestic and fire systems to perform the water main replacement, we had to wait until the building was substantially unoccupied. We understand that the noise impacted you and we apologize for this nuisance.  The contractor is aware that in a mixed use area that the noise ordinance goes into effect to a very quiet level at 11 pm and was diligent in completing the work before then.   We will be required to disconnect the Schrafft?s building when the project is complete and will do a better job of communicating with the other abutters that the work needs to be done. We apologized for the noise.

status_notes: Case Resolved. This is under Runway 27 flight path.  It is the second most frequently used runway for arrivals and the fourth most frequently used runway for departures.  Unfortunately, the runway most frequently used for arrivals, 4R (one end of runway 4R/22L), was closed for maintenance on or about May 15th and it will be closed for all use through the month of June. From the end of June until early August, the 22L end of the runway will be available for arrivals with the 4R end available at some busier times.  Work will continue, however, at the times often most distressing to residents - late at night and early in the morning.  . In general, operations at Logan run at about one every two minutes and the airport often uses the same runway configuration for hours and days at a time.  Although weather is a significant factor in determining the use of runways, it is by no means the only factor.  There is no runway use program for Logan that distributes use equitably and ensures that dwell and persistence (hours and days) are not inequitable. .
description: Airplane noises starting at 5:30 AM

description: The people driving and operating this truck in Brighton today were incredibly disrespectful and causing a major inconvenience to other drivers on the road. This truck has to hold up traffic for quite awhile so a lot of cars line up behind it. There is always one spot where the truck has the opportunity to pull over and let everyone go. Today, the truck had more than one opportunity to let cars go and instead stopped inconveniently so no one could pass. Finally when the usual spot to pull over came up, the driver still chose not to. They stopped where I could just barely get my car through and when asked to either help guide me or move the truck literally 6 inches the man outside of the truck chose to simply yell at me. This is wildly unacceptable behavior. The man behind me was having a mental breakdown while these workers couldn't be bothered to move their truck 3 feet. I respect the jobs that need to get done and the people who do them, but this is ridiculous.
address: Intersection Of Chestnut Hill Dr & Commonwealth Ave, Brighton

status_notes: Case Noted. This is under Runway 27.  So far this year, it is the second most frequently used runway for arrivals and the fourth most frequently used runway for departures.  Operations generally run at about one every two minutes and the airport often uses the same runway configuration for hours and days at a time.  Although weather is a significant factor in determining the use of runways, it is by no means the only factor.  There is no runway use program for Logan that distributes use equitably and ensures that dwell and persistence (hours and days) are not inequitable. .

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. Before excavating in Massachusetts, its the law to call dig safe so that out all the underground utilities are marked out with paint. This allows the contractor to dig safely and not to hit an underground utility line such as the gas main. Its is rightfully so a mandatory requirement . The City does shares your frustration that after the work is complete the paint could be being viewed as graffiti by the public. We have reached out to the utility companies asking if they could develop a paint that wore off more quickly. Obviously the paint needs to stay visible while the work takes place. Because there is so much excavation going on in the City, if we require a utility to power wash off a digsafe marking, we may be washing off new dig safe markings for another ticket called in for a  new excavation. This could cause a contractor to inadvertently hit an underground pipe causing a possible Public Safety situation  and creating a liability issue for the City. Its a dilemma that we are working on, its not an easy remedy .. However it's important to remember that Public Safety trumps all. Eventually the paint should wear off over time. If the markings are still there in the next 60 -90 days please contact my office. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
description: Do you happen to know if we are planning to pave these areas? If not could you work with the utilities companies to find a different way to mark where they need to do work. The attached picture doesn't do justice to how ugly this looks. You really need to go see in person. This isn't how we should represent our city to tourists or residents.. description: Noise complaint. Tishman ad Speyer constantly violate noise ordinances for the city during week days by working past 6pm. They stated that they will work until 10pm at night and it is now 10:41pm and they are still working and causing noise on Tuesday, May 2, 2017. I feel this is appalling that he city would allow this to happen on week nights when people who pay taxes have to go to work in order to support those taxes for the city. I feel that the noise ordinances should be followed by these developers and not disturb the hard working residents of Boston.  These developers should not work past 6pm on weekdays, before 7am on weekdays, or on Sundays at all. This has been such a nuisance and no amount of meetings or discussions with them has rectified this situation. The city needs to take action and enforce the ordinances and not grant permits to annoy and hugely inconvenience their tax paying citizens.
